is no longer required.

commit_message:
Generate plugin list for registry document

This commit makes to generate a plugin list for the registry
document and, also fixes a python3 incompatibility and docs warnings
in generate-grenade-plugins-list.sh.
And this commit also removes doc/source/plugin-registry.rst because
it's generated by the script.

Change-Id: I391ca452f2e99e899ded8e4bcb5649a4511a7696

Cleanup ContainerBroker.get_own_shard_range

Make use of helper method to get own shard range.

Use update_own_shard_range helper and use it to persist
reported meta-timestamps and also when making cleaved shard
brokers.

subject: Make the minor update for docker idempotent
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 20778, 'name': 'Damien Ciabrini', 'email': 'dciabrin@redhat.com', 'username': 'dciabrin'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-02-26 16:42:21.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/docker.yaml'], 'message': "Make the minor update for docker idempotent

Via Ic08468854ce92e81cd84bd6c86a6b672b5a9d49b we fixed the problem of
docker being restarted when puppet triggers a change while pacemaker is
up and running. That approach, while more correct than what existed
previously, is still suboptimal because we are stopping all docker
containers even though we don't have to.

Let's detect if applying the profile::base::docker manifest would
introduce any changes and also detect if the docker rpm is going to be
updated. If one of the two conditions is true we need to stop
containers.

This way rerunning the update workflow on a node should be much less
disruptive. Tested this and correctly observed that the first run did
correctly stopped the docker containers whereas subsequent runs did not
stop containers.

Change-Id: I9176da730b0156d06e2a1ef5f2fcc061e2a6abf6
Related-Bug: #1747851
"}]
commit_message:
Make the minor update for docker idempotent

Via Ic08468854ce92e81cd84bd6c86a6b672b5a9d49b we fixed the problem of
docker being restarted when puppet triggers a change while pacemaker is
up and running. That approach, while more correct than what existed
previously, is still suboptimal because we are stopping all docker
containers even though we don't have to.

Let's detect if applying the profile::base::docker manifest would
introduce any changes and also detect if the docker rpm is going to be
updated. If one of the two conditions is true we need to stop
containers.

This way rerunning the update workflow on a node should be much less
disruptive. Tested this and correctly observed that the first run did
correctly stopped the docker containers whereas subsequent runs did not
stop containers.

Change-Id: I9176da730b0156d06e2a1ef5f2fcc061e2a6abf6
Related-Bug: #1747851

commit_message:
Cleanup the host prep role & remove redundant tasks

The LXC-Container-Create role now has the ability to setup all of the
network interfaces using systemd-networkd. Those changes give us a
uniform interface to consume when we create containers and free's the
roles from having to care about specific container interface config.
This change removes our now redundant tasks.

This also ensures "dbus" is available in the base contianer image
which was simply added for consistency.

Change-Id: I9278b1f73e1e0fdf98ab5fbe016a77aeb3f75be2
Depends-On: I5d3ddcfa11d575648a69a04f2fb30236c2c89da3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Don't use gnocchiclient during publisher init
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-01 17:02:43.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/unit/publisher/test_gnocchi.py', 'ceilometer/publisher/gnocchi.py'], 'message': "Don't use gnocchiclient during publisher init

We can't create archive policies in publisher init because if it fail
because Gnocchi is not yet ready the publisher fail to load. Ceilometer
will work, but samples will go to nowhere.

This change creates/checks archive policies when we publish a sample for
the very first time. If that fail because Gnocchi is not ready, this
will just retry next time Ceilometer will publish samples.

Closes-Bug: #1752420

Change-Id: Ib6b4da54592ad99a4e6561a73473b6c7ec73a21f
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use gnocchiclient during publisher init

We can't create archive policies in publisher init because if it fail
because Gnocchi is not yet ready the publisher fail to load. Ceilometer
will work, but samples will go to nowhere.

This change creates/checks archive policies when we publish a sample for
the very first time. If that fail because Gnocchi is not ready, this
will just retry next time Ceilometer will publish samples.

Closes-Bug: #1752420

Change-Id: Ib6b4da54592ad99a4e6561a73473b6c7ec73a21f

Note that these are not in global-requirements and thus syncing
of requirements fails. Still, syncing will fail due to salt
and dpath.

commit_message:
INFINIDAT: load-balance shares inside network space

Instead of always using the first IP from the INFINIDAT InfiniBox
network space, utilize the export_locations attribute of the share
and return the IPs of all enabled network space IPs.

Change-Id: I2319d574cb95f8cc688e608a7e455743e4e63f93

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-02-12 16:18:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/virt/block_device.py'], 'message': 'Use dict.get() when accessing capabilities dict

Many compute drivers override the driver capabilities dict [1]. The
code should be using dict.get() to avoid throwing KeyErrors if the
overriding dictionaries do not have the corresponding keys. If the
key is not found it will be assumed the the capability is not supported
and default to false. This ensures that no drivers are broken because
they are missing a capability.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5251f18d87/nova/virt/driver.py#L124-L134

Change-Id: I1fa04fa110f2c65e10c065c61f2f0f58c1fad646
Closes-Bug: #1746608
'}]
commit_message:
Use dict.get() when accessing capabilities dict

Many compute drivers override the driver capabilities dict [1]. The
code should be using dict.get() to avoid throwing KeyErrors if the
overriding dictionaries do not have the corresponding keys. If the
key is not found it will be assumed the the capability is not supported
and default to false. This ensures that no drivers are broken because
they are missing a capability.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5251f18d87/nova/virt/driver.py#L124-L134

Change-Id: I1fa04fa110f2c65e10c065c61f2f0f58c1fad646
Closes-Bug: #1746608

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-01-26 16:39:17.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Disable warnings as errors for sphinx

If GENERATE_TEMPEST_PLUGIN_LIST=False, the plugin-registry page is not
generated, and then sphinx fails with:

doc/source/index.rst:69:toctree contains reference to nonexisting
document u'plugin-registry'

Setting the variable to False is a legit use case, used in isolated
build environments like CBS used for RDO packages and should be
supported.

Alternatively, we could make inclusion of the page conditional to the
environment variable value, for example using 'only' directive for
sphinx and passing an appropriate 'tag' as a flag indicating the page is
generated; setup.py interface doesn't seem to provide an explicit way to
pass tags but SPHINXOPTS variable would be handy. Sadly, table of
contents can't be controlled with the directive:
https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/1420

Another alternative would be to generate a stub page with no useful
info just to upease sphinx. I figured it's easier to tweak sphinx
configuration though.

The fix still leaves warnings-as-errors enabled for tox environments
with assumption that if tox is used, the build environment is not as
constrained.

Change-Id: Id174d1679c7b141b0327d8c23d6b14f7db83fae8
"}]
commit_message:
Disable warnings as errors for sphinx

If GENERATE_TEMPEST_PLUGIN_LIST=False, the plugin-registry page is not
generated, and then sphinx fails with:

doc/source/index.rst:69:toctree contains reference to nonexisting
document u'plugin-registry'

Setting the variable to False is a legit use case, used in isolated
build environments like CBS used for RDO packages and should be
supported.

Alternatively, we could make inclusion of the page conditional to the
environment variable value, for example using 'only' directive for
sphinx and passing an appropriate 'tag' as a flag indicating the page is
generated; setup.py interface doesn't seem to provide an explicit way to
pass tags but SPHINXOPTS variable would be handy. Sadly, table of
contents can't be controlled with the directive:
https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/1420

Another alternative would be to generate a stub page with no useful
info just to upease sphinx. I figured it's easier to tweak sphinx
configuration though.

The fix still leaves warnings-as-errors enabled for tox environments
with assumption that if tox is used, the build environment is not as
constrained.

Change-Id: Id174d1679c7b141b0327d8c23d6b14f7db83fae8

commit_message:
Fix the substitution of discovered tag

Specifying prepare --tag-from-label does a full tag discovery but the
results are not inserted into the output files. This change fixes
that.

Change-Id: I2f3ffd4c4f1d844a84fc6d352a26879b0a538c47
Closes-Bug: #1749054

subject: Unify container network interfaces with networkd
revisions:
[{'number': 53, 'created': '2018-03-01 10:55:19.000000000', 'files': ['templates/post-up-down.oneshot.j2', 'tasks/lxc_container_network_new.yml', 'templates/pre-up-down.oneshot.j2', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml', 'templates/suse-routes.j2', 'tests/test-containers-create.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'files/lxc-veth-wiring.sh', 'templates/veth-cleanup.sh.j2', 'tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml', 'vars/redhat-7.yml', 'templates/rhel-interface.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/legacy-networking-convert-networkd-5b514e604df7c429.yaml', 'templates/container_mac_generation.sh.j2', 'templates/debian-interface.cfg.j2', 'handlers/main.yml', 'templates/systemd-hostnamed.conf', 'tests/test.yml', 'vars/main.yml', 'templates/container-setup.sh.j2', 'templates/suse-interface.j2', 'templates/container_network.network.j2', 'tasks/lxc_container_config.yml', 'vars/suse-42.yml', 'templates/rhel-routes.j2', 'tasks/lxc_container_create.yml', 'templates/container-first-run.sh.j2', 'meta/main.yml'], 'message': 'Unify container network interfaces with networkd

Unify container network interfaces using Systemd Networkd for ubuntu,
centos, and openSUSE. This change allows the role to use a single way to
configure container networks.

Care has been taken to ensure we're able to cleanly upgrade to the new
capabilities within existing environments without breaking any feature
compatibility or causing any container restarts.

It's also worth noting that all of the pre/post networking up/down
script options have been converted to systemd "oneshot" services. This
retains the ability to run adhoc scripts post network availability
while also opening up this capability, which used to be ubuntu only,
to all of our supported operating systems.

> Our usage of `lxc-attach` was removed in favor of `nsenter` to fix a
  issue where multiple `lxc-attach` commands issued to a single physical
  host could result in a hang.

> Scripts that were being generated inline have been placed into
  template files. This solves a long standing memory consumption issue
  when creating lots of containers. The old shell tasks will now be 
  executed from a generated script. While this should also help with 
  debugging, the main driver is to ensure better system stability.

> A lot of cleanup has been done throughout the task files and
  templates. In the process of updating the role to use unified
  networking a lot of duplicate tasks, scripts, and processes have
  consolidated.

> Handlers have been added for network connection wait conditions and
  to various service restarts.

> The OSA plugins have been added to this role as a dependency. We
  rely on the connection plugins throughout the stack however we were
  doing a lot of workarounds to cater to the possibility of a deployer
  running this role without them. This change simply adds the plugins
  as a known dependency which allows for a more streamlined setup.

Change-Id: I5d3ddcfa11d575648a69a04f2fb30236c2c89da3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Unify container network interfaces with networkd

Unify container network interfaces using Systemd Networkd for ubuntu,
centos, and openSUSE. This change allows the role to use a single way to
configure container networks.

Care has been taken to ensure we're able to cleanly upgrade to the new
capabilities within existing environments without breaking any feature
compatibility or causing any container restarts.

It's also worth noting that all of the pre/post networking up/down
script options have been converted to systemd "oneshot" services. This
retains the ability to run adhoc scripts post network availability
while also opening up this capability, which used to be ubuntu only,
to all of our supported operating systems.

> Our usage of `lxc-attach` was removed in favor of `nsenter` to fix a
  issue where multiple `lxc-attach` commands issued to a single physical
  host could result in a hang.

> Scripts that were being generated inline have been placed into
  template files. This solves a long standing memory consumption issue
  when creating lots of containers. The old shell tasks will now be 
  executed from a generated script. While this should also help with 
  debugging, the main driver is to ensure better system stability.

> A lot of cleanup has been done throughout the task files and
  templates. In the process of updating the role to use unified
  networking a lot of duplicate tasks, scripts, and processes have
  consolidated.

> Handlers have been added for network connection wait conditions and
  to various service restarts.

> The OSA plugins have been added to this role as a dependency. We
  rely on the connection plugins throughout the stack however we were
  doing a lot of workarounds to cater to the possibility of a deployer
  running this role without them. This change simply adds the plugins
  as a known dependency which allows for a more streamlined setup.

Change-Id: I5d3ddcfa11d575648a69a04f2fb30236c2c89da3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Remove the "max_fail_percentage" option

This option can cause silent failures which are confusing and hard to
track down. While the intention of this was to allow large scale
deployments to succeed in cases where a single node fails due to
transiant issues it has produced more problems in terms of confusion
that it solves. This change removes the option from all production
playbooks.

Change-Id: I1dcbbf5bc8cc66f11dd8ddc22d2a177c5c0f31f1
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit c2743f5cca1930a553ce9f20b207cb17fa6b763d)
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Allow the confgiuration of virtualbmc on Newton

The upcoming fast-forward upgrade TripleO feature in Queens will take a
Newton undercloud and overcloud and upgrade these to the Queens release.

One of the initial tasks during the upgrade is to linearly upgrade the
undercloud from Newton to Queens. However due to the removal of the
pxe_ssh Ironic driver in Pike this is not possible with virtual test
environments deployed using tripleo-quickstart that use pxe_ssh.

Instead of attempting to migrate underclouds using pxe_ssh to use vbmc
during this upgrade this change simply removes the various conditionals
stopping us from deploying Newton using vbmc.

This depends on a change to tripleo-quickstart-extras where additional
conditionals are also removed and more importantly the presence of
python-virtualbmc in the relevant Newton package repositories.

Depends-On: I45b7f9b52dbb18d752abf48c6d040f3d5ad37a29
Change-Id: I184cdb106cb8175aaf7fffcaf518af95ccd0f292

commit_message:
Allow the configuration of virtualbmc on Newton

This would allow tripleo-quickstart deployed Newton underclouds to be
upgraded to Queens as required by fast-forward upgrades and documented
in I184cdb106cb8175aaf7fffcaf518af95ccd0f292.

Change-Id: I45b7f9b52dbb18d752abf48c6d040f3d5ad37a29

commit_message:
Fix the repo cache folder to /opt/stack

The DEST variable in devstack is fixed to /opt/stack, it cannot be
configured. When using a custom devstack_base_dir also the cache
repo was changed and that breaks devstack since it expects the
sources to be in /opt/stack.

Change-Id: I152b0fd8c585baa27a512849d01fe28eff4a132d

commit_message:
Do not set ha.available until clustered

The interface was setting ha.available immediately with no gating.

The hacluster charm sets a relation variable, clustered, when it has
enough peers and has setup corosync. This change updates the
interface to react to this setting. Only set ha.available when
clustered is set and True.

Change-Id: I23eb5e70537a62d5b9e5e24d09f37519b63a1717
Closes-Bug: #1749280

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-02-22 18:57:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/wsgi/test_servers.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Ensure attachment_id always exists for block device mapping

If an instance is deleted before it is scheduled, the BDM
clean-up code uses the mappings from the build request as
they don't exist in the database yet.

When using the older attachment flow with reserve_volume,
there is no attachment_id bound to the block device mapping
and because it is not loaded from database but rather from
the build request, accessing the attachment_id field raises
an exception with 'attachment_id not lazy-loadable'

If we did a new style attach, _validate_bdm will add the
attachment_id from Cinder.  If we did not, then this patch
will make sure to set it to 'None' to avoid raising an
exception when checking if we have an attachment_id set in
the BDM clean-up code

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/functional/wsgi/test_servers.py

Change-Id: I3cc775fc7dafe691b97a15e50ae2e93c92f355be
Closes-Bug: #1750666
(cherry picked from commit 16c2c8b3ee9d70e928a61ceb1ef5931d40e509a4)

Detach volumes when deleting a BFV server pre-scheduling

If the user creates a volume-backed server from an existing
volume, the API reserves the volume by creating an attachment
against it. This puts the volume into 'attaching' status.

If the user then deletes the server before it's created in a
cell, by deleting the build request, the attached volume is
orphaned and requires admin intervention in the block storage
service.

This change simply pulls the BDMs off the BuildRequest when
we delete the server via the build request and does the same
local cleanup of those volumes as we would in a "normal" local
delete scenario that the instance was created in a cell but
doesn't have a host.

We don't have to worry about ports in this scenario since
ports are created on the compute, in a cell, and if we're
deleting a build request then we never got far enough to
create ports.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/functional/wsgi/test_servers.py

Change-Id: I1a576bdb16befabe06a9728d7adf008fc0667077
Partial-Bug: #1404867
(cherry picked from commit 0652e4ab3d506ea21f1bd80b6802c6df5e7b523e)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure attachment_id always exists for block device mapping

If an instance is deleted before it is scheduled, the BDM
clean-up code uses the mappings from the build request as
they don't exist in the database yet.

When using the older attachment flow with reserve_volume,
there is no attachment_id bound to the block device mapping
and because it is not loaded from database but rather from
the build request, accessing the attachment_id field raises
an exception with 'attachment_id not lazy-loadable'

If we did a new style attach, _validate_bdm will add the
attachment_id from Cinder.  If we did not, then this patch
will make sure to set it to 'None' to avoid raising an
exception when checking if we have an attachment_id set in
the BDM clean-up code

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/functional/wsgi/test_servers.py

Change-Id: I3cc775fc7dafe691b97a15e50ae2e93c92f355be
Closes-Bug: #1750666
(cherry picked from commit 16c2c8b3ee9d70e928a61ceb1ef5931d40e509a4)

Detach volumes when deleting a BFV server pre-scheduling

If the user creates a volume-backed server from an existing
volume, the API reserves the volume by creating an attachment
against it. This puts the volume into 'attaching' status.

If the user then deletes the server before it's created in a
cell, by deleting the build request, the attached volume is
orphaned and requires admin intervention in the block storage
service.

This change simply pulls the BDMs off the BuildRequest when
we delete the server via the build request and does the same
local cleanup of those volumes as we would in a "normal" local
delete scenario that the instance was created in a cell but
doesn't have a host.

We don't have to worry about ports in this scenario since
ports are created on the compute, in a cell, and if we're
deleting a build request then we never got far enough to
create ports.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/functional/wsgi/test_servers.py

Change-Id: I1a576bdb16befabe06a9728d7adf008fc0667077
Partial-Bug: #1404867
(cherry picked from commit 0652e4ab3d506ea21f1bd80b6802c6df5e7b523e)

subject: Resolve hostnames if needed to allow access in ufw
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-05 21:36:24.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_swift_storage_utils.py', 'lib/swift_storage_utils.py'], 'message': 'Resolve hostnames if needed to allow access in ufw

In some cases juju 1.25 (with maas 1.9) may return a hostname in the
private-address field breaking the assumption that private-address will
always be an IP address. This patch uses socket.getaddrinfo() to assure
an IP address is given to ufw.

Change-Id: I99b0110beed6075164eb549ec2433071af699c04
Closes-Bug: 1747516
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve hostnames if needed to allow access in ufw

In some cases juju 1.25 (with maas 1.9) may return a hostname in the
private-address field breaking the assumption that private-address will
always be an IP address. This patch uses socket.getaddrinfo() to assure
an IP address is given to ufw.

Change-Id: I99b0110beed6075164eb549ec2433071af699c04
Closes-Bug: 1747516

subject: Update the ssh plugin for selective namespaces
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-01 10:47:37.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/container_namespaces-8a0b9af1ec09060f.yaml', 'connection/ssh.py'], 'message': 'Update the ssh plugin for selective namespaces

The ssh plugin will now use the `nsenter` command to attach to the
container instead of splitting the command functionality between nspawn
and lxc. With the use of `nsenter` we can now selectively use different
namespaces when remotely executing against a container. A new option was
added to the plugin for "container_namespaces" which is a user provided
interface for passing in the namespaces used to attach to the container.
If this option is undefined the default namespaces will be used for full
container isolation.

Change-Id: I904ee68bbc59a0ee4458401a243246bb3f4c3523
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update the ssh plugin for selective namespaces

The ssh plugin will now use the `nsenter` command to attach to the
container instead of splitting the command functionality between nspawn
and lxc. With the use of `nsenter` we can now selectively use different
namespaces when remotely executing against a container. A new option was
added to the plugin for "container_namespaces" which is a user provided
interface for passing in the namespaces used to attach to the container.
If this option is undefined the default namespaces will be used for full
container isolation.

Change-Id: I904ee68bbc59a0ee4458401a243246bb3f4c3523
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

case.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-06 11:11:38.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/resize-image-virtual-size.rst'], 'message': "resize image's virtual size

Currently Cinder does not modify image's virtual size when creating a
volume from image, and the volume size is usually larger than image's
virtual size. If a vm boots from this volume, user will find that
the root disk space is not consistent with the volume size, which is
supposed to be. This spec is trying to resize the image's virtual size
when creating volume from image, so as to make full use of the image
volume.

Change-Id: Iff82fd64b2d6d6258a949a084da3417815ea1a67
blueprint: resize-image-virtual-size
"}]
commit_message:
resize image's virtual size

Currently Cinder does not modify image's virtual size when creating a
volume from image, and the volume size is usually larger than image's
virtual size. If a vm boots from this volume, user will find that
the root disk space is not consistent with the volume size, which is
supposed to be. This spec is trying to resize the image's virtual size
when creating volume from image, so as to make full use of the image
volume.

Change-Id: Iff82fd64b2d6d6258a949a084da3417815ea1a67
blueprint: resize-image-virtual-size

subject: HealthCheck Middleware
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-30 03:53:21.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/healtcheck-middleware.rst'], 'message': "HealthCheck Middleware

Currently Cinder does not have any reasonable means to provide health
check information for example to HAProxy. Any such deployment causes
extensive logging and causes unnecessary operations in the server end
(FE. GET request to / which leads to version check).

HealthCheck Middleware provides <SERVER>:<PORT>/healtcheck endpoint.
This endpoint behaves similar way as it does in Swift. Normal operation
returns 200 'OK', and if config option disable_path is enabled with
existence of that path, it will return 503 'DISABLED BY FILE'.

Change-Id: I0ef8018e5dad4b25635c8ae0f93f1e2ef3b5219a
blueprint: healthcheck-middleware
"}]
commit_message:
HealthCheck Middleware

Currently Cinder does not have any reasonable means to provide health
check information for example to HAProxy. Any such deployment causes
extensive logging and causes unnecessary operations in the server end
(FE. GET request to / which leads to version check).

HealthCheck Middleware provides <SERVER>:<PORT>/healtcheck endpoint.
This endpoint behaves similar way as it does in Swift. Normal operation
returns 200 'OK', and if config option disable_path is enabled with
existence of that path, it will return 503 'DISABLED BY FILE'.

Change-Id: I0ef8018e5dad4b25635c8ae0f93f1e2ef3b5219a
blueprint: healthcheck-middleware

commit_message:
Add functional test for deleting BFV server with old attach flow

When creating a new instance and deleting it before it gets scheduled
with the old attachment flow (reserve_volume), the block device mappings
are not persisted to database which means that the clean up fails
because it tries to lookup attachment_id which cannot be lazy loaded.

This patch adds a (failing) functional test to check for this issue
which will be addressed in a follow-up patch.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/functional/wsgi/test_servers.py

Related-Bug: #1750666
Change-Id: I294c54e5a22dd6e5b226a4b00e7cd116813f0704
(cherry picked from commit 3120627d9802ceda46c2db387fec8fbc80700338)

subject: Clean up ports and volumes when deleting ERROR instance
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1004, 'name': 'Mohammed Naser', 'email': 'mnaser@vexxhost.com', 'username': 'mnaser'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}, {'_account_id': 27609, 'name': 'ZHICE WANG', 'email': 'wangzc@awcloud.com', 'username': 'wangzhice'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-02-22 18:57:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1404867.py', 'nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1670627.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1689692.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Clean up ports and volumes when deleting ERROR instance

Usually, when instance.host = None, it means the instance was never
scheduled. However, the exception handling routine in compute manager
[1] will set instance.host = None and set instance.vm_state = ERROR
if the instance fails to build on the compute host. If that happens, we
end up with an instance with host = None and vm_state = ERROR which may
have ports and volumes still allocated.

This adds some logic around deleting the instance when it may have
ports or volumes allocated.

  1. If the instance is not in ERROR or SHELVED_OFFLOADED state, we
     expect instance.host to be set to a compute host. So, if we find
     instance.host = None in states other than ERROR or
     SHELVED_OFFLOADED, we consider the instance to have failed
     scheduling and not require ports or volumes to be freed, and we
     simply destroy the instance database record and return. This is
     the "delete while booting" scenario.

  2. If the instance is in ERROR because of a failed build or is
     SHELVED_OFFLOADED, we expect instance.host to be None even though
     there could be ports or volumes allocated. In this case, run the
     _local_delete routine to clean up ports and volumes and delete the
     instance database record.

Co-Authored-By: Ankit Agrawal <ankit11.agrawal@nttdata.com>
Co-Authored-By: Samuel Matzek <smatzek@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: 1404867
Closes-Bug: 1408527

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/55ea961/nova/compute/manager.py#L1927-L1929

Change-Id: I4dc6c8bd3bb6c135f8a698af41f5d0e026c39117
(cherry picked from commit b3f39244a3eacd6fb141de61850cbd84fecdb544)
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up ports and volumes when deleting ERROR instance

Usually, when instance.host = None, it means the instance was never
scheduled. However, the exception handling routine in compute manager
[1] will set instance.host = None and set instance.vm_state = ERROR
if the instance fails to build on the compute host. If that happens, we
end up with an instance with host = None and vm_state = ERROR which may
have ports and volumes still allocated.

This adds some logic around deleting the instance when it may have
ports or volumes allocated.

  1. If the instance is not in ERROR or SHELVED_OFFLOADED state, we
     expect instance.host to be set to a compute host. So, if we find
     instance.host = None in states other than ERROR or
     SHELVED_OFFLOADED, we consider the instance to have failed
     scheduling and not require ports or volumes to be freed, and we
     simply destroy the instance database record and return. This is
     the "delete while booting" scenario.

  2. If the instance is in ERROR because of a failed build or is
     SHELVED_OFFLOADED, we expect instance.host to be None even though
     there could be ports or volumes allocated. In this case, run the
     _local_delete routine to clean up ports and volumes and delete the
     instance database record.

Co-Authored-By: Ankit Agrawal <ankit11.agrawal@nttdata.com>
Co-Authored-By: Samuel Matzek <smatzek@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: 1404867
Closes-Bug: 1408527

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/55ea961/nova/compute/manager.py#L1927-L1929

Change-Id: I4dc6c8bd3bb6c135f8a698af41f5d0e026c39117
(cherry picked from commit b3f39244a3eacd6fb141de61850cbd84fecdb544)

commit_message:
django2: Replace django.core.urlresolves with django.urls

(In Django 2.0) The django.core.urlresolvers module is removed
in favor of its new location, django.urls.
It was depreacted in Django 1.10:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/1.10/#id3

blueprint django2-support
Change-Id: I46ab5c325491274b8eaffbf848e5d80f83c2fd26

commit_message:
Overhaul HealthManager update threading

* Switch to ProcessPool from ThreadPool (Python threads are horrible)
* Load the health/stats update drivers correctly with stevedore
* Add logging driver

Change-Id: Icda4ff218a6bbaea252c2d75c073754f4161a597

subject: Change confusing test class names
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-01 12:04:04.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py'], 'message': "Change confusing test class names

These names contain 'NoMox', which is confusing when none of our tests
use mox. These were added in the commit that adds Keystone v3 API
support, and the difference between them is that they test Keystone v2
versus Keystone v3 APIs. Name them as such.

Change-Id: I72c300c546e04917bd57be327efd51e93c1d1f09
"}]
commit_message:
Change confusing test class names

These names contain 'NoMox', which is confusing when none of our tests
use mox. These were added in the commit that adds Keystone v3 API
support, and the difference between them is that they test Keystone v2
versus Keystone v3 APIs. Name them as such.

Change-Id: I72c300c546e04917bd57be327efd51e93c1d1f09

commit_message:
Add non-voting standard upgrade job

To make it easier to switch the upgrade job to non-voting
temporarily in the repositories which have it, have a
standard non-voting one to switch to.

Change-Id: I22623cb84aa9ad48be10bbeb53ba898e99b17371
(cherry picked from commit 1c3b36b320627db81deadc6428c7a2e295642905)

commit_message:
Remove periodic translations job

The translations job should only run in master as periodic, as
it's intended to be doing the most upstream work.

Change-Id: If1083aeab1481364af466fb722ce0cf8bc44ce83

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-13 12:46:13.000000000', 'files': ['troveclient/tests/osc/v1/test_database_clusters.py'], 'message': "Fix invalid mock in OSC cluster creating unittest

As '_parse_instance_options' is imported into database_clusters, mocking
destination should be the database_clusters module, not the original
troveclient.v1.shell.

The reason this test passed before this patch is, the return value of
'_parse_instance_options' is not checked, i.e. the mock object is also
useless. This patch also checks how troveclient.v1.clusters.create is
called to ensure '_parse_instance_options' is correctly mocked.

Change-Id: I903a3b9565e4044c33401a6abcc47d50a5a2567f
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix invalid mock in OSC cluster creating unittest

As '_parse_instance_options' is imported into database_clusters, mocking
destination should be the database_clusters module, not the original
troveclient.v1.shell.

The reason this test passed before this patch is, the return value of
'_parse_instance_options' is not checked, i.e. the mock object is also
useless. This patch also checks how troveclient.v1.clusters.create is
called to ensure '_parse_instance_options' is correctly mocked.

Change-Id: I903a3b9565e4044c33401a6abcc47d50a5a2567f
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Make Opendaylight as the BGP speaker with 6WIND Quagga

1. It adds os_quagga role which is executed from quagga playbook if
bgpvpn depolyment option is chosen
2. Quagga packages are kept as tar.gz package in remote location,
downloaded/extracted/configured as local distribution repository
(apt/yum/zypper) accordingly to install the Quagga and its dependent
packages seamlessly
3. Quagga to be installed on the neutron server nodes, but its configued
as BGP speaker for OpenDaylight in one of the neutron server node in
cluster environment.
4. An experimenter zuul job is added to validate the quagga installation

Change-Id: I96e76788a76b6e0c2e8000af4516d1998f9de23b
Signed-off-by: Periyasamy Palanisamy <periyasamy.palanisamy@ericsson.com>

subject: Workaround glitchy container stats in probe test after shrinking
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-01 09:15:29.000000000', 'files': ['test/probe/test_sharder.py'], 'message': 'Workaround glitchy container stats in probe test after shrinking

The root container stats can temporarily glitch during shrinking.
The stats will settle down after sharders are cycled but this can
mean that the probe test intermittently fails to delete the root
container because the root thinks it still has objects.

Removing the update from donor shard might reduce the glitchiness
but would add more delay to root finding out that shrink has
completed.

By only running sharder on shard containers we get the stats
update while avoiding the root container triggering any
shrinking.

Change-Id: I27fba5026bf8fe45edc2db7932573bb84fc65208
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround glitchy container stats in probe test after shrinking

The root container stats can temporarily glitch during shrinking.
The stats will settle down after sharders are cycled but this can
mean that the probe test intermittently fails to delete the root
container because the root thinks it still has objects.

Removing the update from donor shard might reduce the glitchiness
but would add more delay to root finding out that shrink has
completed.

By only running sharder on shard containers we get the stats
update while avoiding the root container triggering any
shrinking.

Change-Id: I27fba5026bf8fe45edc2db7932573bb84fc65208

commit_message:
Enable native mode for ScaleIO volumes

Native AIO mode is beneficial for ScaleIO volumes;
performance is slightly better and it utilizes fewer host
resources.

Change-Id: I1cd8742481a17536d906e2bf130e4958ef181ea0

subject: Prepare t-h-t for undercloud in a work dir
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-01 12:42:03.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/undercloud/test_undercloud_deploy.py', 'tripleoclient/constants.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/undercloud_config.py', 'tripleoclient/utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/undercloud-deploy-tht-4af4b91774600e8f.yaml', 'tripleoclient/v1/undercloud_deploy.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': "Prepare t-h-t for undercloud in a work dir

The issue here is that the undercloud heat installer
default uses template in /usr/share and renders the
result of the process-templates.py in place.

Process templates in a temporary work dir created
from the source --templates dir under the --output-dir.
Delete it after the undercloud deployment done, or failed
with an exception, unless --no-cleanup is specified.
Ensure the --output-dir exists for all of the cases.

The --output-dir and --no-cleanup may be passed
either as the 'undercloud deploy' CLI args, or via
the undercloud.conf file, as output_dir and no_cleanup.
The latter way only works for 'undercloud install --use-heat'.

Also, share process_multiple_environments in utils lib.
Reuse the shared process_multiple_environments for
undercloud and overcloud heat installers and add unit tests.

Additionally, fix the shared process_multiple_environments
redirect/rewrite: only redirect and rewrite paths, if fully
matched.

Closes-Bug: #1752272
Closes-Bug: #1749683
Change-Id: Ib0c2e3ffd81742441400d27857afae457d71a424
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I68ffbbfc84ea360880e776f44c45c9fed72bb29f
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Prepare t-h-t for undercloud in a work dir

The issue here is that the undercloud heat installer
default uses template in /usr/share and renders the
result of the process-templates.py in place.

Process templates in a temporary work dir created
from the source --templates dir under the --output-dir.
Delete it after the undercloud deployment done, or failed
with an exception, unless --no-cleanup is specified.
Ensure the --output-dir exists for all of the cases.

The --output-dir and --no-cleanup may be passed
either as the 'undercloud deploy' CLI args, or via
the undercloud.conf file, as output_dir and no_cleanup.
The latter way only works for 'undercloud install --use-heat'.

Also, share process_multiple_environments in utils lib.
Reuse the shared process_multiple_environments for
undercloud and overcloud heat installers and add unit tests.

Additionally, fix the shared process_multiple_environments
redirect/rewrite: only redirect and rewrite paths, if fully
matched.

Closes-Bug: #1752272
Closes-Bug: #1749683
Change-Id: Ib0c2e3ffd81742441400d27857afae457d71a424
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I68ffbbfc84ea360880e776f44c45c9fed72bb29f
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add check for redundant import aliases

This adds a pep8 function that will check for redundant import aliases.
Any imports of the forms below will not be allowed.

from x import y as y
import x as x
import x.y as y

Change-Id: Iff90f0172d97bd1d49d54c811a70c8af11776da4

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2018-02-24 02:27:40.000000000', 'files': ['gate/post_test_hook.sh'], 'message': "Check for leaked server resource allocations in post_test_hook

The post_test_hook.sh runs in the nova-next CI job. The 1.0.0
version of the osc-placement plugin adds the CLIs to show consumer
resource allocations.

This adds some sanity check code to the post_test_hook.sh script
to look for any resource provider (compute nodes) that have allocations
against them, which shouldn't be the case for successful test runs
where servers are cleaned up properly.

Change-Id: I9801ad04eedf2fede24f3eb104715dcc8e20063d
"}]
commit_message:
Check for leaked server resource allocations in post_test_hook

The post_test_hook.sh runs in the nova-next CI job. The 1.0.0
version of the osc-placement plugin adds the CLIs to show consumer
resource allocations.

This adds some sanity check code to the post_test_hook.sh script
to look for any resource provider (compute nodes) that have allocations
against them, which shouldn't be the case for successful test runs
where servers are cleaned up properly.

Change-Id: I9801ad04eedf2fede24f3eb104715dcc8e20063d

commit_message:
Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

This commit removes the unused TEMPEST_SERVICES setting
Related-Bug: #1743688

Change-Id: I1fe2b6161494648cd8d08860afcab1551e64bae2

commit_message:
Make firewall l2 agent extension more generic

Currently, firewall l2 agent extension is not compatible with LB agent.
This patch make firewall l2 agent extension to be more generic by moving
'request_int_br' to driver side.

Change-Id: Ibcbf55b3cfd960a04b515933c8ede8b4e16cf0b9
Related-Bug: #1752006

subject: Use aio_basekit scenario for OpenSUSE
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-28 09:21:46.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/project.yaml', 'zuul.d/jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'Use aio_basekit scenario for OpenSUSE

The aio_basekit scenario is helping the CentOS tests complete
more often and this could help the OpenSUSE tests as well.
This patch adds a non-voting gate test for OpenSUSE using the
aio_basekit scenario. It also disables the existing OpenSUSE
tests since they time out frequently.

Depends-On: Ie1bde8981e46361b611bee0d0be9ff6e5919821b
Change-Id: Ib4a80f7c67518029adf7c6c7bca7d4a95f3f43c9
'}]
commit_message:
Use aio_basekit scenario for OpenSUSE

The aio_basekit scenario is helping the CentOS tests complete
more often and this could help the OpenSUSE tests as well.
This patch adds a non-voting gate test for OpenSUSE using the
aio_basekit scenario. It also disables the existing OpenSUSE
tests since they time out frequently.

Depends-On: Ie1bde8981e46361b611bee0d0be9ff6e5919821b
Change-Id: Ib4a80f7c67518029adf7c6c7bca7d4a95f3f43c9

and (b) breaks doc publication in the 'post' gate.

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-08 17:26:12.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I1ed2e8e85dc558a1990f3fe048eab1e1177ab601
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I1ed2e8e85dc558a1990f3fe048eab1e1177ab601

commit_message:
Fix flakey test_check_delete_headers_sets_delete_at

It was rare (saw it once in 10k runs running locally), but it's
ocassionally blown up in the gate [1]. With this, no fails locally even
after 100k runs.

subject: Add new attach check to ensure attached volume is visible
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-01 11:17:31.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/volumes/test_attach_volume.py'], 'message': 'Add new attach check to ensure attached volume is visible

There are times when a volume is visible from within an instance but
is no longer readable by the instance. This can happen if the backend
storage device attachment gets inadvertantly disconnected from the
instance.

This change adds a new mechanism in the attach tests to verify that no
only is the volume visible in the instance, but that it is also readable.
The check is sending a command to the instance to have it re-read
the partition table.

Related-Bug: 1752115
Depends-On: Idc5cecffa9129d600c36e332c97f01f1e5ff1f9f

Change-Id: I38b9f4857f65508a2424bf31ceb82003c42804a4
'}]
commit_message:
Add new attach check to ensure attached volume is visible

There are times when a volume is visible from within an instance but
is no longer readable by the instance. This can happen if the backend
storage device attachment gets inadvertantly disconnected from the
instance.

This change adds a new mechanism in the attach tests to verify that no
only is the volume visible in the instance, but that it is also readable.
The check is sending a command to the instance to have it re-read
the partition table.

Related-Bug: 1752115
Depends-On: Idc5cecffa9129d600c36e332c97f01f1e5ff1f9f

Change-Id: I38b9f4857f65508a2424bf31ceb82003c42804a4

commit_message:
Make debug option working for UC heat installer

The debug option can not be picked up from the conf file,
when --use-heat is passed for undercloud install CLI.
Fix unit test to match the default debug=True.

Change-Id: I3c90e4d0cab34dc4bb4f981e87baa5da9f9bd657
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

subject: Switch to stestr for generating subunit results
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-01 07:39:48.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': 'Switch to stestr for generating subunit results

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504345/ moves the tempest run
  cli to stestr. In order to avoid breakage switch to stestr from
  testr.
* Check for .testresposity and .stestr folder and then use respective
  test runner. It will avoid the breakage in CI.

Change-Id: Ic6c5fb4bdf883708cf4fc08486db7e89e0a76c6a
(cherry picked from commit c5a7236f78dc9a5a81cf58d8f13041cd657b585e)

Remove --regex from tempest command when running with RDO

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504345/ has changed the behavior of tempest
when running with --regex and --whitelist-file [1]

In order to promote we need to remove this regex option and implement [2] when ready
after promotion.

This patch is removing totally the --regex when not running in UCA. Note these tests
were disabled in [3] and hopefully they are more stable now and we can run
without skipping them until we can implement --blacklist-file.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1751115
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547278
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/461969/

Change-Id: I0dd846a383ed2e1cb4c699a42e618156a9e628b2
(cherry picked from commit 9325150ded93079a819a9800929a643402f3f532)
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to stestr for generating subunit results

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504345/ moves the tempest run
  cli to stestr. In order to avoid breakage switch to stestr from
  testr.
* Check for .testresposity and .stestr folder and then use respective
  test runner. It will avoid the breakage in CI.

Change-Id: Ic6c5fb4bdf883708cf4fc08486db7e89e0a76c6a
(cherry picked from commit c5a7236f78dc9a5a81cf58d8f13041cd657b585e)

Remove --regex from tempest command when running with RDO

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504345/ has changed the behavior of tempest
when running with --regex and --whitelist-file [1]

In order to promote we need to remove this regex option and implement [2] when ready
after promotion.

This patch is removing totally the --regex when not running in UCA. Note these tests
were disabled in [3] and hopefully they are more stable now and we can run
without skipping them until we can implement --blacklist-file.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1751115
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547278
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/461969/

Change-Id: I0dd846a383ed2e1cb4c699a42e618156a9e628b2
(cherry picked from commit 9325150ded93079a819a9800929a643402f3f532)

subject: Conditionally adjust for quoting in comparing MySQL defaults
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-22 20:55:27.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/sqlalchemy/test_migrations.py'], 'message': 'Conditionally adjust for quoting in comparing MySQL defaults

MariaDB 10.2 appears to not return server defaults with quotes
around integer values which breaks the assumption that we have
to de-quote server default values.  Make the dequoting
a regexp that will pass when the quotes are not present.

Change-Id: Ie5aeffcc3c550673a7fdd82769a315821cebb272
Closes-bug: #1750414
'}]
commit_message:
Conditionally adjust for quoting in comparing MySQL defaults

MariaDB 10.2 appears to not return server defaults with quotes
around integer values which breaks the assumption that we have
to de-quote server default values.  Make the dequoting
a regexp that will pass when the quotes are not present.

Change-Id: Ie5aeffcc3c550673a7fdd82769a315821cebb272
Closes-bug: #1750414

subject: Add a new aioeventlet executor
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 8415, 'name': 'Denis M.', 'email': 'lildee1991@gmail.com', 'username': 'dmakogon'}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}, {'_account_id': 13290, 'name': 'Oleksii Zamiatin', 'email': 'ozamiatin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ozamiatin'}, {'_account_id': 13777, 'name': 'Nicolas Trangez', 'email': 'ikke@nicolast.be', 'username': 'nicolast'}]

[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-02-05 11:17:08.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/tests/executors/test_executor.py', 'requirements.txt', 'oslo_messaging/_executors/impl_eventlet.py', 'oslo_messaging/_executors/impl_aioeventlet.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Add a new aioeventlet executor

The new executor supports trollius coroutines, explicit asynchronous
programming, in addition to eventlet greenthreads, implicit asynchronous
programming.

The new AsyncioEventletExecutor class is based on the EventletExecutor
class and so it is compatible with it. The aioeventlet executor can be
used to replace the eventlet executor, but it requires an aioeventlet
event loop running in the thread running the executor (usually the main
thread). See AsyncioEventletExecutor docstring for an example how to
setup such event loop.

The aioeventlet module implements the asyncio API (PEP 3156) on top of
eventlet, see aioeventlet documentation:
http://aioeventlet.readthedocs.org/

The change adds an unit test with an endpoint implemented as a trollius
coroutine.

The executor is not supported on Python 3 yet because of eventlet issues
with monkey patching.

Implements: blueprint greenio-executor
Change-Id: I7a78ed998719a703077232726f66d882463b1297
'}]
commit_message:
Add a new aioeventlet executor

The new executor supports trollius coroutines, explicit asynchronous
programming, in addition to eventlet greenthreads, implicit asynchronous
programming.

The new AsyncioEventletExecutor class is based on the EventletExecutor
class and so it is compatible with it. The aioeventlet executor can be
used to replace the eventlet executor, but it requires an aioeventlet
event loop running in the thread running the executor (usually the main
thread). See AsyncioEventletExecutor docstring for an example how to
setup such event loop.

The aioeventlet module implements the asyncio API (PEP 3156) on top of
eventlet, see aioeventlet documentation:
http://aioeventlet.readthedocs.org/

The change adds an unit test with an endpoint implemented as a trollius
coroutine.

The executor is not supported on Python 3 yet because of eventlet issues
with monkey patching.

Implements: blueprint greenio-executor
Change-Id: I7a78ed998719a703077232726f66d882463b1297

subject: Add aioeventlet dependency
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 8415, 'name': 'Denis M.', 'email': 'lildee1991@gmail.com', 'username': 'dmakogon'}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-28 10:40:31.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Add aioeventlet dependency

aioeventlet implements the asyncio API (PEP 3156) on top of eventlet:
http://aioeventlet.readthedocs.org/

aioeventlet works on Python 2.6-3.5 and is distributed under the Apache
License 2.0.

I wrote this project to be able to convert incrementally code from
implicit asynchronous programming (eventlet) to explicit asynchronous
programming (asyncio). The project is part of a blueprint to support
asyncio in OpenStack. Roadmap to replace eventlet with trollius/asyncio:
http://aioeventlet.readthedocs.org/openstack.html#history

The first step in OpenStack is the following change for Oslo Messaging,
"Add a new aioeventlet executor":
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/136653/

A previous try was based on the greenio module, but greenio doesn't fit
well in OpenStack. For the whole history of the integration of asyncio
into OpenStack, read:
http://aioeventlet.readthedocs.org/openstack.html#history

Implements: blueprint greenio-executor
Change-Id: I58cc28f0a6cba4e17741b1987212e711b20eca54
'}]
commit_message:
Add aioeventlet dependency

aioeventlet implements the asyncio API (PEP 3156) on top of eventlet:
http://aioeventlet.readthedocs.org/

aioeventlet works on Python 2.6-3.5 and is distributed under the Apache
License 2.0.

I wrote this project to be able to convert incrementally code from
implicit asynchronous programming (eventlet) to explicit asynchronous
programming (asyncio). The project is part of a blueprint to support
asyncio in OpenStack. Roadmap to replace eventlet with trollius/asyncio:
http://aioeventlet.readthedocs.org/openstack.html#history

The first step in OpenStack is the following change for Oslo Messaging,
"Add a new aioeventlet executor":
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/136653/

A previous try was based on the greenio module, but greenio doesn't fit
well in OpenStack. For the whole history of the integration of asyncio
into OpenStack, read:
http://aioeventlet.readthedocs.org/openstack.html#history

Implements: blueprint greenio-executor
Change-Id: I58cc28f0a6cba4e17741b1987212e711b20eca54

commit_message:
Need to follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more detials information, please refer to:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

To handle this, this commit changes:

- Introduce doc/requirements.txt
- Update tox.ini [docs] target for developer convenience
- Fixes a lot of warnings caused by a newer sphinx 1.6.5 because
  sphinx specified in upper-constraints.txt is used in the new PTI.
- Drop unnecessary [pbrp] warnerrors in favor of warning-is-error.

Change-Id: If40305044c9dfe0024b64bd3921232bb0a6c9372

commit_message:
Fix docker build job configuration

Docker builds post action failed because the post.yaml was targeted on
a non-existing host. The job has been changed to not publish the
image any more as a zip file as it is easy to reproduce locally and
they are useful only for development or quick starting which is
done locally anyway.

Change-Id: I13babe1d519c25a3889d07d98f383901ccbf6302
Closes-Bug: 1751592

subject: Add proto 'all' per subnet network cidr FORWARD rules in both directions
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 20778, 'name': 'Damien Ciabrini', 'email': 'dciabrin@redhat.com', 'username': 'dciabrin'}, {'_account_id': 21486, 'name': 'wangqi', 'email': 'wang.qi@99cloud.net', 'username': 'wangqi'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2018-02-24 13:32:26.000000000', 'files': ['instack_undercloud/undercloud.py', 'instack_undercloud/tests/test_undercloud.py'], 'message': 'Add proto 'all' per subnet network cidr FORWARD rules in both directions

In change I904bbbac383f5fddbe6a88177ef65981d009d28c we added the
following nat rules, which will default to something like:
 # 140 network cidr nat rules
  "140 ctlplane-subnet cidr nat": {"chain": "FORWARD", "destination": "192.168.24.0/24"}

The problem is that the tripleo::firewall::rule class defaults to proto
'tcp' and hence we will not allow any UDP traffic forwarding and that we
only allow traffic towards the overcloud and not from the overcloud.

This can become problematic when the overcloud uses DNS outside any
directly reachable network because if the outside network traffic for
the overcloud is routed and natted through the undercloud, UDP traffic
will be silently dropped.

pcsd is particularly sensitive to DNS timing out, see:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1452561

Change-Id: I21ebdc18fbe55466b2a65c568ceab9b26240557c
Closes-Bug: #1750880
'}]
commit_message:
Add proto 'all' per subnet network cidr FORWARD rules in both directions

In change I904bbbac383f5fddbe6a88177ef65981d009d28c we added the
following nat rules, which will default to something like:
 # 140 network cidr nat rules
  "140 ctlplane-subnet cidr nat": {"chain": "FORWARD", "destination": "192.168.24.0/24"}

The problem is that the tripleo::firewall::rule class defaults to proto
'tcp' and hence we will not allow any UDP traffic forwarding and that we
only allow traffic towards the overcloud and not from the overcloud.

This can become problematic when the overcloud uses DNS outside any
directly reachable network because if the outside network traffic for
the overcloud is routed and natted through the undercloud, UDP traffic
will be silently dropped.

pcsd is particularly sensitive to DNS timing out, see:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1452561

Change-Id: I21ebdc18fbe55466b2a65c568ceab9b26240557c
Closes-Bug: #1750880

subject: Add openstackdocstheme support and infer names
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-07 17:22:07.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/sphinxutil.py', 'doc/source/user/packagers.rst', 'doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Add openstackdocstheme support and infer names

All but two of the openstackdocstheme settings can be inferred by files
that pbr can know to be around. Infer them, and set the
openstackdocstheme settings.

Note - this is likely not the best way to go about this long-term. Since
we're trying to import openstackdocstheme - we'll have the object if
it's around. That means we could add a companion method in
openstackdocstheme that takes globals, project_name, bug_name, bug_tag
and repo_name and sets whatever options it needs to set.

Change-Id: I00ad9b207a77b95ea29bd52bee66cf828c8f23eb
"}]
commit_message:
Add openstackdocstheme support and infer names

All but two of the openstackdocstheme settings can be inferred by files
that pbr can know to be around. Infer them, and set the
openstackdocstheme settings.

Note - this is likely not the best way to go about this long-term. Since
we're trying to import openstackdocstheme - we'll have the object if
it's around. That means we could add a companion method in
openstackdocstheme that takes globals, project_name, bug_name, bug_tag
and repo_name and sets whatever options it needs to set.

Change-Id: I00ad9b207a77b95ea29bd52bee66cf828c8f23eb

The LaTeX option in particular is set incorrectly in pretty much
everyone's conf.py. Almost nothing in OpenStack is written by "the

Let's get rid of the copy-pasta.

Change-Id: I86e0c662fa23487131c18261b4a0b4108e76bcac
'}]
commit_message:
Add htmlhelp and latex options

The LaTeX option in particular is set incorrectly in pretty much
everyone's conf.py. Almost nothing in OpenStack is written by "the
OpenStack Foundation".

Let's get rid of the copy-pasta.

Change-Id: I86e0c662fa23487131c18261b4a0b4108e76bcac

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-02-21 23:36:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1404867.py', 'nova/tests/fixtures.py'], 'message': 'Add functional tests to ensure BDM removal on delete

In certain cases, such as when an instance fails to be scheduled,
the volume may already have an attachment created (or the volume
has been reserved in the old flows).

This patch adds a test to check that these volume attachments
are deleted and removed once the instance has been deleted. It
also adds some functionality to allow checking when an volume
has been reserved in the Cinder fixtures.

This backported patch drops the tests for the new-attach flow
for Cinder as it does not exist in Pike.

Change-Id: I85cc3998fbcde30eefa5429913ca287246d51255
Related-Bug: #1404867
(cherry picked from commit 20edeb362327ea9448d38b6e2bcb03e0a71060d0)
'}]
commit_message:
Add functional tests to ensure BDM removal on delete

In certain cases, such as when an instance fails to be scheduled,
the volume may already have an attachment created (or the volume
has been reserved in the old flows).

This patch adds a test to check that these volume attachments
are deleted and removed once the instance has been deleted. It
also adds some functionality to allow checking when an volume
has been reserved in the Cinder fixtures.

This backported patch drops the tests for the new-attach flow
for Cinder as it does not exist in Pike.

Change-Id: I85cc3998fbcde30eefa5429913ca287246d51255
Related-Bug: #1404867
(cherry picked from commit 20edeb362327ea9448d38b6e2bcb03e0a71060d0)

commit_message:
Parameterize expirer unit tests

To prepare for implementing general task queue mode to expirer,
this patch parameterize expirer unit tests' conf, expected log lines,
task queue status, and others.
The parameterized unit tests will make expirer's general task queue
patch [1] more smaller.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517389

Change-Id: Ie16dfdc5966d1438ff7dad30a0515ca04c3311fc

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-13 17:16:27.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/admin/configuration/schedulers.rst', 'doc/source/admin/node-down.rst'], 'message': "Fix and update compute schedulers config guide

There were several things wrong with this doc since the migration
in-tree in pike, which are handled here:

- Updated options to use the current names.
- Any mention of the periodic_task_interval option is removed
  since this doc is really about the FilterScheduler, and the
  periodic task interval is only used by the CachingScheduler to
  cache and refresh hosts, something the FilterScheduler doesn't do.
  The note about service_down_time is already covered in the help
  text for the periodic_task_interval option.
- Removed a broken (and oddly placed) link to the block storage
  docs; it's unclear why the compute scheduler docs need to randomly
  link to the block storage docs for schedluing (maybe that was
  super legacy from the nova-volume days).
- Fixed a broken link to the 'evacuate instances' docs.

This change does not get into details for the individual filters
or weighers, only the overview and filter scheduler description.

Change-Id: Ie5bb9781e1997ad12521b5df5245a78b587a4a20
Closes-Bug: #1749235
"}]
commit_message:
Fix and update compute schedulers config guide

There were several things wrong with this doc since the migration
in-tree in pike, which are handled here:

- Updated options to use the current names.
- Any mention of the periodic_task_interval option is removed
  since this doc is really about the FilterScheduler, and the
  periodic task interval is only used by the CachingScheduler to
  cache and refresh hosts, something the FilterScheduler doesn't do.
  The note about service_down_time is already covered in the help
  text for the periodic_task_interval option.
- Removed a broken (and oddly placed) link to the block storage
  docs; it's unclear why the compute scheduler docs need to randomly
  link to the block storage docs for schedluing (maybe that was
  super legacy from the nova-volume days).
- Fixed a broken link to the 'evacuate instances' docs.

This change does not get into details for the individual filters
or weighers, only the overview and filter scheduler description.

Change-Id: Ie5bb9781e1997ad12521b5df5245a78b587a4a20
Closes-Bug: #1749235

commit_message:
Switch to stestr for generating subunit results

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504345/ moves the tempest run
  cli to stestr. In order to avoid breakage switch to stestr from
  testr.
* Check for .testresposity and .stestr folder and then use respective
  test runner. It will avoid the breakage in CI.

Change-Id: Ic6c5fb4bdf883708cf4fc08486db7e89e0a76c6a
(cherry picked from commit c5a7236f78dc9a5a81cf58d8f13041cd657b585e)

subject: Enable more hacking-extensions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-01 02:42:50.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Enable more hacking-extensions

This patch enable extensions:
-[H204] Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality.
-[H205] Use assert(Greater|Less)(Equal) for comparison.
-[H106] Don't put vim configuration in source files
-[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

Change-Id: Ic18d895140d35c59ee4d5b70980212465551d797
"}]
commit_message:
Enable more hacking-extensions

This patch enable extensions:
-[H204] Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality.
-[H205] Use assert(Greater|Less)(Equal) for comparison.
-[H106] Don't put vim configuration in source files
-[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

Change-Id: Ic18d895140d35c59ee4d5b70980212465551d797

Do not have to mention ssl_ca_cert in vim config file (server)

This patch along with  another patch on the tacker client

configuration file.

subject: Do not complete MongoDBContext with out replset
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-24 21:13:48.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ceilometer_contexts.py'], 'message': 'Do not complete MongoDBContext with out replset

When there are multiple mongodb peers but replset has not yet been set
on the relation, do not complete the MongoDBContext. This causes the
template to be rendered incorrectly and leads to the following error:

ERROR ceilometer ValueError: Port must be an integer between 0 and
65535:

Closes-Bug: #1750639
Change-Id: Ifb9424ac5e175d788fa21de0ee332c0a13e61a9f
'}]
commit_message:
Do not complete MongoDBContext with out replset

When there are multiple mongodb peers but replset has not yet been set
on the relation, do not complete the MongoDBContext. This causes the
template to be rendered incorrectly and leads to the following error:

ERROR ceilometer ValueError: Port must be an integer between 0 and
65535:

Closes-Bug: #1750639
Change-Id: Ifb9424ac5e175d788fa21de0ee332c0a13e61a9f

subject: Explicitly call configure_ssl
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-26 17:21:47.000000000', 'files': ['src/reactive/gnocchi_handlers.py'], 'message': 'Explicitly call configure_ssl

Although, layer_openstack_api calls configure_ssl the ordering is
indeterminate. Explicitly call configure_ssl in the charm layer before
services are enabled to avoid attempting to start apache2 before
certificates are available.

Change-Id: Icb40bbcf4ca920be202584e9e25ffd1c2b9c8d61
Partial-Bug: #1750915
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly call configure_ssl

Although, layer_openstack_api calls configure_ssl the ordering is
indeterminate. Explicitly call configure_ssl in the charm layer before
services are enabled to avoid attempting to start apache2 before
certificates are available.

Change-Id: Icb40bbcf4ca920be202584e9e25ffd1c2b9c8d61
Partial-Bug: #1750915

commit_message:
image_pull_policy does not work in glance driver

When I use the following command to create a container:
zun create --image-pull-policy always --image-driver glance ubuntu
the '--image-pull-policy always' does not work

Change-Id: I9429ac28a620ace3f3894f127388c8131cfbbcba
Closes-Bug: #1752015

subject: Remove --regex from tempest command when running with RDO
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1004, 'name': 'Mohammed Naser', 'email': 'mnaser@vexxhost.com', 'username': 'mnaser'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 12393, 'name': 'chandan kumar', 'display_name': 'Chandan Kumar', 'email': 'chkumar@redhat.com', 'username': 'chkumar246'}, {'_account_id': 13861, 'name': 'yatin', 'email': 'ykarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'yatinkarel'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 16312, 'name': 'Alfredo Moralejo', 'email': 'amoralej@redhat.com', 'username': 'amoralej'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-23 09:00:42.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': 'Remove --regex from tempest command when running with RDO

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504345/ has changed the behavior of tempest
when running with --regex and --whitelist-file [1]

In order to promote we need to remove this regex option and implement [2] when ready
after promotion.

This patch is removing totally the --regex when not running in UCA. Note these tests
were disabled in [3] and hopefully they are more stable now and we can run
without skipping them until we can implement --blacklist-file.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1751115
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547278
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/461969/

Change-Id: I0dd846a383ed2e1cb4c699a42e618156a9e628b2
'}]
commit_message:
Remove --regex from tempest command when running with RDO

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504345/ has changed the behavior of tempest
when running with --regex and --whitelist-file [1]

In order to promote we need to remove this regex option and implement [2] when ready
after promotion.

This patch is removing totally the --regex when not running in UCA. Note these tests
were disabled in [3] and hopefully they are more stable now and we can run
without skipping them until we can implement --blacklist-file.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1751115
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547278
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/461969/

Change-Id: I0dd846a383ed2e1cb4c699a42e618156a9e628b2

commit_message:

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504345/ moves the tempest run
  cli to stestr. In order to avoid breakage switch to stestr from
  testr.
* Check for .testresposity and .stestr folder and then use respective
  test runner. It will avoid the breakage in CI.

commit_message:
Fix potential KeyError in execution tests

- Remove the scripts 'stolen' from openstack-helm project for k8s
  installation. Use ansible and kubeadm instead.
- Update the doc
- Change the test_process_limit.py to avoid being affected by outside
  environment (e.g. the jenkins gate node)

Story: 2001595
Change-Id: I604af8eb38921f5a0838de2f89f32360bdcf6d42

subject: filesystem storage: don't ensure base path when initialization
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-02-27 12:40:37.000000000', 'files': ['qinling/storage/file_system.py'], 'message': "filesystem storage: don't ensure base path when initialization

The path is only required when storing a package and is guaranteed
before that. Thus it is not needed to ensure that path upon
FileSystemStorage initialization.

This commit also removes the usage of global CONF variable in the
qinling.storage.file_system module, as according the recommendation of
oslo.config it is not recommended.

Change-Id: Id3ccbb172ecc68c135624996b781448e2a69b4a9
"}]
commit_message:
filesystem storage: don't ensure base path when initialization

The path is only required when storing a package and is guaranteed
before that. Thus it is not needed to ensure that path upon
FileSystemStorage initialization.

This commit also removes the usage of global CONF variable in the
qinling.storage.file_system module, as according the recommendation of
oslo.config it is not recommended.

Change-Id: Id3ccbb172ecc68c135624996b781448e2a69b4a9

commit_message:
Remove migrated jobs for sahara repositories

Replaced by their working counterparts:
- sahara-tests: all legacy jobs with the exception of the multinode
  job (not working yet);
- sahara: all legacy jobs with the exception of the multinode and
  the grenade job.
- python-saharaclient: all legacy jobs.

The native jobs works on stable/pike, stable/queens and master.
Ocata is going out of support in few days
and a last release for Sahara was tagged few days ago.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/546694
Change-Id: I67bfed58d339343502e3483e693ff15d3eeec064

subject: Do not have to mention ssl_ca_cert in vim config file (client)
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-02-26 07:17:43.000000000', 'files': ['tackerclient/tests/unit/vm/test_vim_utils.py', 'tackerclient/tacker/v1_0/nfvo/vim_utils.py', 'tackerclient/tests/unit/vm/test_cli10_vim_k8s_with_bearer_token.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Do not have to mention ssl_ca_cert in vim config file (client)

Current tacker client requires us to mention ssl_ca_cert
and set it to None if we don't want to use ssl cert. This
patch along with another patch on the tacker server side
will make ssl_ca_cert a truly optional config. And, only
the correct ssl_ca_cert will be able to authenticate.

Tacker Server changes: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/546580/

Change-Id: Ic87fe3382e100183c685c3b34768a5a5de889982
"}]
commit_message:
Do not have to mention ssl_ca_cert in vim config file (client)

Current tacker client requires us to mention ssl_ca_cert
and set it to None if we don't want to use ssl cert. This
patch along with another patch on the tacker server side
will make ssl_ca_cert a truly optional config. And, only
the correct ssl_ca_cert will be able to authenticate.

Tacker Server changes: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/546580/

Change-Id: Ic87fe3382e100183c685c3b34768a5a5de889982

commit_message:
Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

This commit removes the unused TEMPEST_SERVICES setting
Related-Bug: #1743688

Change-Id: I43faa01a8f3756ba3fa95098af417e9256943f67
